featured.text: Black tea preparation consists mainly of picking young leaves and leaf buds on a clear sunny day and letting the leaves dry for about an hour in the sun.
The ability is 25 to those with leaves that are hydrophobic, or repel water—a special feature that forces the liquid to move away when the leaf is exposed to it.

Additionally, by having branches that do not touch those of their neighbors, trees may be able to limit the spread of leaf-eating insects, and potentially also the transmission of diseases from tree to tree.
Scientists already knew earlier that wind and splashes of rainwater can move bacteria and other germs from leaf to leaf.

other.text: They found that the sick plants could “sneeze” and 23 tiny water drops filled with leaf rust germs, spreading the disease to neighboring plants.
22 other possible transmission routes, researchers at Virginia Tech observed water drops on the leaves of wheat plants that were infected with leaf rust.

definition.zh_def: 植物的綠色部分，通常由葉片和葉柄組成，主要用於光合作用。
definition.en_def: The green part of a plant, typically consisting of a blade and a petiole, primarily used for photosynthesis.
definition.example: The tree's leaves turned bright colors in the fall.
